channel.title: The Butt bites us in Technology
channel.description: Does anyone ever think of how significantly our lives will change if technology just.. died on us?

item.title: The Butt bites us in Technology
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“goatee, post:17, topic:254402”]TBH we would just make more that actually work. If you talking about all electrically powered things not working and not being able to work due to some massive permanent EMP pulse coming from a giant angels arsehole then of course we would be set back a bit, but we would not go into all out war and chaos as you might think. Afterall, you don’t start raging and looting the place when you turn your light off at night do you?

The main problem would be communication, we rely pretty much solely on computers to communicate for us over distances of like…above 100m, so we would only be able to speak to people close to us, meaning no one would know if the whole world has shut down for quite sometime. Once we did find out then I’m sure places wouldn’t be too badly effected as the human race is remarkably good at adapting, we would just revert back to the old style way of lighting at night, like candles and fires and shit.

Eventually we would get back on track, fix the giant angels arsehole and start rebuilding our lives, maybe with a little more caution so as not to upset anymore giant angels. To the OP, the change would effect us enormously, but would not end us.[/quote]
it is possible to make electronics resistant to EMP’s we were learning about it in Physics.

Read full topic
item.source: The Butt bites us in Technology

item.title: The Butt bites us in Technology
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

TBH we would just make more that actually work. If you talking about all electrically powered things not working and not being able to work due to some massive permanent EMP pulse coming from a giant angels arsehole then of course we would be set back a bit, but we would not go into all out war and chaos as you might think. Afterall, you don’t start raging and looting the place when you turn your light off at night do you?

The main problem would be communication, we rely pretty much solely on computers to communicate for us over distances of like…above 100m, so we would only be able to speak to people close to us, meaning no one would know if the whole world has shut down for quite sometime. Once we did find out then I’m sure places wouldn’t be too badly effected as the human race is remarkably good at adapting, we would just revert back to the old style way of lighting at night, like candles and fires and shit.

Eventually we would get back on track, fix the giant angels arsehole and start rebuilding our lives, maybe with a little more caution so as not to upset anymore giant angels. To the OP, the change would effect us enormously, but would not end us.

EDIT: And obviously there would be a large amount of death due to disease (water treatment facilities are run eletrically) and an even larger amount of crime due to naughty noobs taking advantage of their situation.

Read full topic
item.source: The Butt bites us in Technology

item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

when you say technology, thats a bit vague. I assumed, in my earlier post, that it was electronic things that defined your meaning of technology. But technically everything is technology. Even hand fashioned tools from the stone age is technology.

item.title: The Butt bites us in Technology
item.dc:creator: @Squigglyo Squigglyo
item.description:
@Squigglyo wrote:

[quote=“runescape3dude, post:11, topic:254402”][quote author=Squigglyo link=topic=336172.msg2613404#msg2613404 date=1230883764]

All in all, we might not be the first advanced humans to have ever roamed the earth.

i believe a little thing called Science might disagree with you.
Absalutly nothing shows any proof of this theroy.

BUT, theres a good chance that older ‘humans’ exist in another galaxy
[/quote]

Absolutely nothing shows any disproof of this theory. For all we know, every 65 million years or so, we screw something up and get set back, all man made things rot in the end.[/quote]

the theroy itself has just as much base as religion.
The theroy is just a ‘hmm, perhaps if this and this happened, then this might happen too’

there would have to be even the smallest bit of evidence, if there was a sentient life form living on earth at any time.

Read full topic

item.title: The Butt bites us in Technology
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

We would adapt and learn to survive in the wild. People will not learn new things for a very long time, children will not be taught to read, etc. But over about 15000 years or so, life would one again return to how it is now. There would be no records of the old civilizations, so everyone would just think that nothing had happened.

But also in this case, there could have already been a civilization of humans on another planet, who did not lose their technology, they could act like aliens or gods.

All in all, we might not be the first advanced humans to have ever roamed the earth.

Read full topic
item.source: The Butt bites us in Technology

The society we know and hate would collapse. Without sustainable computers there would be chaos, confusion, and in the end - hell. We need to stop so heavily relying on computers, and start relying on good ol’ wit.

item.title: The Butt bites us in Technology
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

Uriko:

Does anyone ever think of how significantly our lives will change if technology just… died on us?

Technology is a pretty vague term, which could include most things humans create. I’m going to narrow the question down to what would happen if all the computers died. There would be mass chaos. Just thinking about satellites and space stations and advanced weapons programs, and of course electronic banking, we’d probably be facing an apocalyptic situation fairly quickly.

Read full topic
